net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class ResultSetTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTableModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.ResultSetTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableModel

    public class ResultSetTableModel
extends AbstractTableModel
    This class extends AbstractTableModel to provide support for a ResultSet. It requires a JDBC 2.0 compliant driver since cursor movement is used.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns the number of rows in the model. If the number of rows cannot be efficiently determined, this method may return -1. In that case the isRowValid() method can be used to determine if a given row is valid.
        Returns:
        The number of rows or -1 if the number of rows cannot efficiently be calculated.

      • getValueAt

        public Object getValueAt(int row,
                int column)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index, in the interval [0,getRowCount()], may be zero even if getRowCount() is zero.
        column - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()), may be zero even if getColumnCount() is zero.
        Returns:
        Object or null, must return null if the row or column index are invalid.

      • isRowValid

        public boolean isRowValid(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTableModel
        This implementation of isRowValid() returns true if the rowIndex is in the interval [0,getRowCount()). Returns true if the row is valid in this model. In general a row should be valid if it is less than the value of getRowCount(). Determining getRowCount() may not be efficient for all models so this method is provided to determine if a given row is valid. It is assumed that if a row is invalid, all the rows with an index greater than the row checked are also invalid.
        Specified by:
        isRowValid in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        isRowValid in class AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        true if the row is valid.

      • setIncludeRowNo

        public void setIncludeRowNo(boolean b)
        Set if the row number is to be included as a column.
        Parameters:
        b - true to include the row number as a column.
